data.title: Fast, inexpensive, and casual in Lincoln
data.text: So glad we went here for dinner during a visit to Lincoln. Fresh food, comfortable and clean restaurant, with friendly service. Great place for families with little children.

data.title: Excellent Pho Factory
data.text: Great atmosphere. Clean environment. The staff is very friendly. The food.....oh my....very good! It is a must!

data.title: Quite close to authentic Viet
data.text:
Vietnamese food is no stranger to us.

We have tasted many in various countries.  

This is quite close to authentic taste of  Vietnam. Of course some of the menu items are 'localise' for American. 

First time i see Oxtail Pho in Vietnamese menu but it's good. Beef noodle is recommended. 

Spring rolls are good too. Vietnam coffee is not bad. Tea is not good. .  

Wok fried are so so. It come with rice too. 

Guess if you want Asian food, this is a good place.

data.title: Yum, and consistently delicious
data.text: The phone factory consistently has delicious food.  I have had the seafood photo twice, spicy pho, and chicken pho. All good, just depends on my choice for the day. The appetizers are great (watch for the red hot peppers!).

data.title: Incredible Pho
data.text: First introduction to Pho for my family.   It was so good and everyone loved it.   Could have used some more noodels but that's only because it was so good.

data.title: Good Pho on 27th
data.text:
The broths are clear, clean, and hot.  Flavorful meat selections for those interested in the traditional (think tendon, flank, meat balls) to cuts for the less adventurous (rare steak-->yum!).  The appetizers are few but tastey and pretty typical.  The Hot Pots are killer and you won't be disappointed.  It's never been busy when I've patroned this venue but that is not because of a lack of quality in the food.  Everyone should try this place at least once.  

The "bar" area is always covered in boxes and seems more of a storage location than a bar.  It's just never been free of clutter when I've visited.  This is a small issue and hasn't stopped me from eating here at least once a month.  Enjoy!

data.title: Noodle bowl.
data.text: We have had lunch there several times. My friend likes to order the sweet potato with shrimp appetizer. We like the noodle bowl with beef. Vegetables are fresh and the atmosphere is good.

data.title: It was your average Pho
data.text: When I try something new and different I want to be wowed!  I thought this was just OK.  My son liked his soup and was quite impressed by the size of his serving - but I thought his meatballs were rather bland.  Mine had steak which was OK - but plain. Nothing about this meal made me anxious to come back.  When we went in the restaurant was not busy.  Our crab Rangoon appetizer was overcooked and shouldn't made it out of the kitchen.  The servings are more than generous and the extras that you can add to the broth are fun and tasty.  The non pho offerings were rather limited.  Good price for the serving.  But it wasn't as amazing as I had hoped and the heavy noodles don't reheat well.

data.title: Good food, pleasant atmosphere
data.text:
We lucked on to this place in an area not famous for great, fresh-food restaurants. I had the vermicelli noodle combo; my friend had the jasmine rice combo with chicken. Both were fresh & tasty with wonderful, complex herb/spice mixtures. 
We were pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere of this place too: clean & calm with real napkins & chopsticks. Our server was super friendly & efficient. We wouldn't hesitate to eat here again.

data.title: Healthy, fresh, and flavorful
data.text: This is actually my second visit to this place. I did not consider myself a fan of Vietnamese food, and I was not really impressed on my first visit here. I can't remember what I had, but it wasn't really my thing. This time I had the vermicelli bowl with grilled shrimp. It was delicious! I loved the freshness of the ingredients, especially the fresh herbs. It was too much for me to eat at the time, and I'm looking forward to eating the leftovers. We also had the shrimp cakes, which were fried shredded potato and onion patties with a prawn on top. They were alright, especially with the dipping sauce.

data.title: Terrific Phó
data.text: This contemporary, inviting restaurant serves phó that is flavorful, and filled with fresh ingredients. Many different varieties are available. The combination with flank, brisket, and meatball was filling with lots of additional ingredients served on the side. The staff is very friendly and is willing to accommodate various tastes and tolerances for spices and unique ingredients. The cabbage and chicken salad was also excellent.

data.title: Mediocre
data.text: Had vermicelli with bbq pork and spring roll. Tasted good, like a regular bowl of Vietnamese noodles. Pricey.

data.title: Delicious and Reasonable
data.text:
It was a slightly cooler day in Lincoln when we arrived so the thought of soup just sounded good and I am partial to Pho Ga.  After checking out various sites about possible restaurants we ended up at Pho Factory.  Thuy (sp?) our waitress was a delight; she was friendly and informative.  

We ordered the tofu spring rolls and Hanoi shrimp cakes for appetizers; both were excellent and more than enough for three people.  Our mains were the Pho Ga Speciality, Tofu Pho and Spicy Thai Hot Pot.  Thuy gave excellent suggestions on mixing the various sauces into delicious concoctions.  Everything was delicious.  The portions are (too) large and the prices very reasonable.

data.title: Good Pho when you want a low calorie hot lunch
data.text: Have been here a couple of times.  Had the grill each time and never have been disappointed.  For three was less than $40.  My wife had chicken cabbage salad -- she was very pleased.  The amount of food was more than adequate and the service was very good.  I recommend this restaurant for those wanting good pho for a reasonable price.

data.title: Winter Day Lunch
data.text: With it snowing we wanted some warm soup. This is the place. Great pho.  Spring rolls were made fresh, the shrimp cakes were interesting large shrimp ontop of sweet potato fries.  Curry sweet potato chicken was delicious.  The bacon shrimp soup had alittle spice to it yummy.

data.title: Overdone & cold
data.text: My friend suggested we try a restaurant he had enjoyed in the past (previously named New Saigon). Unfortunately, the dish he normally orders -- and the one he suggested I try -- was not prepared as usual. His pork was overdone and cold. It was a shrimp and pork dish from the grill. It appeared that the pork was precooked and/or left to cool too long after grilling. It was not freshly grilled, as advertised on the menu. My friend talked to the server, who talked to the cook. The cook told the server the meal was exactly as it should be. That was it. We spoke to the manager who was more understanding and removed the meal from our bill. If the cook had apologized for the mistake that would have been one thing but to deny that the meal was not prepared well was a slap in the face. We will need to think carefully before we return to this restaurant.

data.title: Factory Pho is the way to go
data.text: After a Husker game we were looking for someplace to grab a meal, and we turn onto 27th street near W and spy the Pho Factory, and thought, why not try something different.  We went in and the place was really nice, comfortable and quiet.  Menu offered a wide variety of options for every taste.  Easy explanations.  We tried the Build Your Own Pho with rare Steak, and the Special Chicken Pho, and both were delicious.  We opted for the medium bowl, and wow, even that was Huge!  Great prices, excellent food.  My daughter said she would be bringing her dorm mates back.

data.title: Best pho in Lincoln
data.text:
I love this place and have been on several different occasions. Don't be put off by the "Factory" name, this place has some delicious, authentic food. I come for the pho, as it is one of the very few places in Nebraska that I have found that offer tendon and tripe in their pho (along with brisket, fatty brisket, rare steak, flank, and meatball). The pho comes with a mountain of sprouts, cilantro, basil, peppers, and a lime wedge (these items should be standard at most pho places, but I find that sprouts, cilantro, and lemon are only typically offered around these parts). You can choose between a small (which is fairly large on its own), medium, large, or "Challenge" size bowls. The broth is not the meatiest or brownest I've had; it is slightly more subtle flavored, but I prefer my pho that way. If pho isn't your thing, there are a ton of other Vietnamese dishes on the menu that are fantastic.

The interior is clean and rather upscale (granite tabletops and tv's at the front of the restaurant) and I've never had a problem with service. All in all, I can get a great meal of fresh spring rolls and pho for under $15 plus tax and tip.

data.title: Great place, may be in top 5 in Lincoln
data.text: Excellent cooking, clean, very delicious. Recommend for those who love food with a kick. Fast service too.

data.title: Very Good Pho
data.text: I got turned on to Pho on a resent trip so I looked around Lincoln for a place with good Pho. The staff was very help full and willing to explain the menu to us. The food we had was very good and well priced. We both had Pho and we also tired the Tamarind Wings and the Vietmamese Egg Rolls and all the food was very good. The place was very clean and updated.
